interface.name: MultivariateRealDistribution
interface.javadoc:
Base interface for multivariate distributions on the reals. This is based largely on the RealDistribution interface, but cumulative distribution functions are not required because they are often quite difficult to compute for multivariate distributions.
$Id: MultivariateRealDistribution.java 1416643 2012-12-03 19:37:14Z tn $
3.1

Returns the probability density function (PDF) of this distribution evaluated at the specified point {@code x}. In general, the PDF is the derivative of the cumulative distribution function. If the derivative does not exist at {@code x}, then an appropriate replacement should be returned, e.g. {@code Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY}, {@code Double.NaN}, or the limit inferior or limit superior of the difference quotient.
x Point at which the PDF is evaluated.
the value of the probability density function at point {@code x}.

Reseeds the random generator used to generate samples.
seed Seed with which to initialize the random number generator.

Gets the number of random variables of the distribution. It is the size of the array returned by the {@link #sample() sample}method.
the number of variables.

Generates a random value vector sampled from this distribution.
a random value vector.

Generates a list of a random value vectors from the distribution.
sampleSize the number of random vectors to generate.
an array representing the random samples.
org.apache.commons.math3.exception.NotStrictlyPositiveExceptionif {@code sampleSize} is not positive.
#sample()
